ygData.subject: Re: Need some opinions n purachsing game
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t think that you would have to worry about looking odd.  There are plenty of newbies on even now.  I am going to start up again soon myself from about a
ygData.messageBody:
I don't think that you would have to worry about looking odd. There
are plenty of newbies on even now. I am going to start up again soon
myself from about a six month break. I am lookinh forward to
starting from level one again that was half the fun o the game to me
working my way up in levels :o) What server are you going to play
on? I would recomend E'c as I played that one when I was a total
newbie and found the people great and very helpfull.

John Russo




--- In theeverquesttavern@yahoogroups.com, "Yagermeister
<odd_yager@y...>" <odd_yager@y...> wrote:
> Hey everyone,
>
> I need some help on my next MPORPG purchase. I played EQ since Beta
> and quit about 2 and half years ago (college took priority heh) and
> now that I have secured a somewhat stable career, I'm planning to
hit
> online RPGing again. Question is, being that EQ has been out for 5
> years, is it too late to come back and start anew? Meaning am I
going
> to look ridiculous (prolly will regardless) being the only lvl 6
guy
> on the server in cloth and using fine steel? Realistically, I'm
> assuming after all of these years a large percentage of the players
> have either progressed to upper echelon in levels, or populated
with
> tweeked alternates. Should I be looking at another MPORPG like
> Camelot (a bit more recent)? Suggestions are appreciated.
>
> Regards,
>
> Yager
